summary: i think killing eve has ruined all other fanfiction for me .... no other ship is quite as interesting and people like...

blog.name: eve-and-villanelle
blog.title: I Feel Things When I'm With You
blog.description: Trinity // Lesbian // 17 // Killing Eve is taking over my life // I'm in love with Villanelle whoops // Let Villanelle watch movies with someone 2k19 // I'm a killing eve fan first and a human second // Please talk to me it'll make my day!!

summary: okay this is very very far fetched but what if something triggers Villanelle to go back to Eve and help her? yeah this is very...
question: okay this is very very far fetched but what if something triggers Villanelle to go back to Eve and help her? yeah this is very far fetched dsgksdjhgsakdg
answer: Villanelle seems very upsetti spaghetti™ @ Eve right now so I don’t think she’s gonna go back for her but we can all hope absjshsd. If she does have a miraculous change of heart and does end up going back for her I don’t think Eve is going to be there when she comes. I have a feeling someone would have found her and picked her up by then and Villanelle would be like ‘wtf where tf is Eve I swore I left her right here’ and go on a warpath to find her. Someone write that fic honestly ahsiajsdjk

blog.name: anonfanfic
blog.title: The Anon Your Mom Warned You About.
blog.description:
I write, ramble, try to help when I can. I can't tell you what you'll find on this blog on any given day. But I can tell you it will probably be gay.
I love getting prompts for stories. I can't guarantee I'll be able to get to all of them.

title: “Please, make it stop.” - Villaneve prompt
body:
Villanelle walked into the dark hallway. It was like any other mission, find the target and eliminate them. It was a little different since she joined the good guys, well what Villanelle thought of as the good guys. She couldn’t be as creative as she wanted to be with her kills. It was annoying, but seeing Eve most days made up for it.

Carolyn had warned her the man she was after knew he was wanted and had become unstable. He had been on the run for months and killed the raid police that had cornered him in London. He was smart and knew exactly what he needed to do to evade capture. Villanelle had no desire to capture the man.

Villanelle felt the switchblade in the hem of her black leather pants. She wanted to make this kill up close and personal. No one escaped once Villanelle found them. She could only hope he’d put up a fight to keep it a little interesting.

Villanelle heard soft music coming from the closed door on the far right. She felt her heart rate pick up and the beautiful adrenaline start to flow freely through her body. She was alive again.

The music got louder the further she moved down the hall. The door was open just enough for Villanelle to see a sliver of light.

She opened the door slowly, grabbing the knife from her waistband and smiling. The look of shock on the targets face was one of her favorite parts.

Villanelle stood in the doorframe and as she took in the sight before her she felt her blood run cold in her veins.

“No,” She whispered, the knife gripped tightly in her left hand.

“You must be the one she was waiting for.” The man stood in the middle of the room with a knife to Eve’s neck. “I hope for her sake you’re better at this than she is.” He smiled and Villanelle could see almost every yellow tooth in his head. She hated him, the feeling burned like a furnace in the pit of her stomach.

“Let her go. I’ll kill you quickly. I promise.” Villanelle knew better than to show her cards. If she let her guard down she was giving this man power. She hated the thought of that.

Villanelle actually hated that she could feel her heart hammering in her chest as she saw the sharp metal blade so close to Eve’s pulse point. She hated that this guy held any power over her.

“What did you do, Eve?” Villanelle asked, pushing open her own knife and looking at Eve.

“I was coming to warn you.” Eve could have been terrified, but Villanelle was impressed how well she was holding her composure. “He knew we were coming. I didn’t..” Eve trailed off and Villanelle cocked her head curiously.

“You didn’t what?” Villanelle proded, erasing the man from her mind. All she wanted to know was what Eve had been thinking following her here.

“I didn’t want you to get hurt,” Eve confessed, the quiet tone of her voice having nothing to do with the weapon pressing into her skin.

Villanelle felt a prickling sensation crawling up her spine. It lingered on the back of her neck and intensified as she looked into Eve’s dark eyes.

“Not to interrupt this sweet moment, but I’m ready to slit her fucking throat.” The man looked confused by the exchange between the two women.

“Let me tell you how this will end.” Villanelle was in her element now and she knew it. Her confidence filled like a balloon in her chest, she was not going to let Eve die here. “You kill her and I make sure they are finding pieces of your body for years.”

Villanelle saw the familiar flicker of fear in the man’s eyes. It excited her to gain more control from him.

“If you let her go I will let you live. You will walk out of this house and go on with whatever shit life you were living. I don’t give a damn.”

He looked like he was considering his options. Villanelle was ready to kill him. She was calculating if she could get to him before he slid the knife completely across Eve’s neck.

“Tell you what. I’m not going to kill her.” He removed the knife from Eve’s neck. “But I am going to slow you down.”

Without another word Villanelle watched him plunge the knife into Eve’s stomach. Eve immediately crumbled to the ground with a should of pain.

“Fuck!” Villanelle yelled, rushing over and grabbing Eve and putting her head on her lap. “You’re okay, you’re fine.”

Villanelle barely registered the man rushing out of the room. She pulled out her phone and told Carolyn to call an ambulance.

Eve was shaking in her arms and Villanelle could barely send the message before dropping her phone onto the carpeted ground beneath them.

“It hurts.” Eve’s eyes were filled with tears as she looked up at Villanelle. “Please, make it stop.”

Villanelle pressed her hand against the wound. The red stain had already spread across Eve’s shirt. Villanelle could see the wound was deep

“It’s fine. You’re fine,” Villanelle kept repeating. “Help is coming and I’m not leaving you.”

“I just-” Eve struggled for breath and Villanelle had push down the instinct to chase the man who had done this to her.

“It’s okay you don’t have to talk.” Villanelle wasn’t sure what fear felt like, but she imagined it was something like this. She couldn’t handle the idea of the light leaving Eve’s eyes right in front of her.

Eve shook her head and took in a shallow and shaky breath. “I didn’t want you to get hurt.”

Villanelle used her free hand to cup Eve’s cheek. “You’re so stupid, Eve. So stupid.” She slowly caressed Eve’s cheek with her thumb.

“I know,” Eve laughed, leaning into Villanelle’s touch.

Villanelle heard the sirens pulling up in front of the flat.

“They’re here. I’ll see you soon” Villanelle stood up and wiped the blood onto her pants.

Eve looked up at Villanelle complete understanding on her face. “Please be careful.”

“He’s going to suffer. I’ll meet you at the hospital.” Villanelle grabbed her knife once again and prepared for the hunt. This guy had no idea what he was in for, Villanelle was ready to show him exactly what happened when you pissed her off.
body_abstract: Villanelle walked into the dark hallway. It was like any other mission, find the target and eliminate them. It was a little different since she joined the good guys, well what Villanelle thought of as the good guys. She couldn’t be as creative as she wanted to be with her kills. It was annoying, but seeing Eve most days made up for it.

summary: Petty Pride & Joy - an Eve/Villanelle fic  Dream Eve is good, though real Eve is better. What Villanelle didn’t expect was the...
caption:
Petty Pride & Joy - an Eve/Villanelle fic 

Dream Eve is good, though real Eve is better. What Villanelle didn’t expect was the deep seated proprietary pleasure of watching Eve move around in the things she had procured for her, or that it would flow both ways. It started with the belt, and moved from there, to the long hallways of her mind.
